intro: Larsenianthus arunachalensis var. reticulatus, commonly known as the Arunachal Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats at high altitudes. Its leaves are often heart-shaped and have a distinctive reticulate venation pattern. It is a rare and endangered species, found primarily in the state of Arunachal Pradesh in India.
